Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the fabric contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as wine of Perhaaenpaaten, giving the name of the head vintner as Anenef.
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3, plate LXXXVIII n. 90. Wahlberg, The Wine Jars Speak, p.111 n. 118.
